sources.title: The Scarlet Brand (1932) BOB CUSTER
sources.description:
Stars: Bob Custer, Betty Mack, Robert Walker
Director: J.P. McGowan

Bud Bryson is framed and branded for cattle rustling. Walker's brand was used, and he heads for the Walker ranch to get revenge. He gets a job there and slowly realizes that Walker was not responsible. But when the man who framed him appears, he goes into action.

TRIVIA: Born Raymond Anthony Glenn on October 18, 1898, in Frankfort, Kentucky, Bob Custer made his film debut in the 1920s and quickly became a popular figure in the B-Western genre. His rugged good looks and ability to perform his own stunts helped him stand out among the many cowboy stars of the era.
